Description: Black-topped red ware 'tulip'-shaped Kerma beaker with a slightly flattened base; red-brown fabric, black on the exterior rim and the interior surface with a grey and black wavy band around the middle of the exterior surface. Handmade. Incomplete with some reconstruction.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Northern Dongola Reach, Site R25 Context 137
Type series: NDRS type BK1.3 (published form type series number)
Curator's comments: Marked with KNE 137 (survey site code 'KNE' superceded by R25)
Bibliographic references: Welsby Sjöström 2001a / The Pottery from the Survey (p.320, fig. 5.51)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sudan Archaeological Research Society
Division of Finds: National Corporation for Antiquities and Museums (NCAM)
Acquisition notes: Division of finds from the National Corporation for Antiquities and Museums, Khartoum to SARS, the license holder.
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 210x (excavation type series number)
